intro: Maxburretia rupicola, commonly known as the rock fig, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered greenish-white flowers followed by edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and fruit production, it is cultivated in some areas for both horticultural and agricultural purposes.
